paragraphs.text: The Letter of Caldonius, Herculanus, and Others, on the Excommunication of Felicissimus with His People.
Argument.-Caldonius, Herculanus, and Others Carry into Effect What the Preceding Letter Had Bidden Them.
The Letter of Caldonius, Herculanus, and Others, on the Excommunication of Felicissimus with His People.
Argument.-Caldonius, Herculanus, and Others Carry into Effect What the Preceding Letter Had Bidden Them.

Caldonius, with Herculanus and Victor, his colleagues, also with Rogatianus and Numidicus, presbyters.[fn-53-P5374_1637654:2-nf] We have rejected Felicissimus and Augendus from communion; also Repostus from among the exiles, and Irene of the Blood-stained ones;[fn-53-P5375_1637819:3-nf] and Paula the sempstress; which you ought to know from my subscription; also we have rejected Sophronius and Soliassus (budinarius),[fn-53-P5376_1638009:4-nf] -himself also one of the exiles.

references.text: "Rutili," scil. confessors who had spilt their blood.
Probably low Latin for a maker of force-meats. Spanish, budin.
